meanings.sent1: Stop with the bushwah and tell me the truth.
meanings.sent2: He always fills his speeches with bushwah to sound important.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's bushwah had the audience laughing uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: Her excuses were just a bunch of bushwah to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The teacher saw through the student's bushwah and asked for a real explanation.

meanings.sent1: I can't stand his constant bushwah about his achievements.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's bushwah didn't convince anyone to buy the product.
meanings.sent3: His apology seemed like nothing but bushwah to avoid punishment.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises turned out to be mere bushwah to win votes.
meanings.sent5: Don't listen to his bushwah; he never keeps his word.

meanings.sent1: The article was full of bushwah meant to mislead the readers.
meanings.sent2: She saw through his bushwah and uncovered the truth.
meanings.sent3: His elaborate story was just a web of bushwah to cover up his mistake.
meanings.sent4: The con artist's smooth talk was all bushwah to scam people.
meanings.sent5: The detective sifted through the suspect's bushwah to find the real clues.
